metadata.synopsis: In the arctic, as Saiva (Michelle Yeoh) is being born, a shaman declares that she is evil and will bring harm to all who become involved with her. Saiva is cast out of her tribe of herders and grows up to live a nomadic existence with Anja (Michelle Krusiec), a young woman she adopts as an infant. Then Loki (Sean Bean), an injured and starving soldier, stumbles into their isolated lives. The women nurse him back to health, but treachery, violence and doom await them all.

reviews: This is one tough and confronting film, its beauty only adding to the shock value
The freaky finale kind of undermines any sympathy we might have built up, but it adds a level of classical storytelling that makes the film feel utterly timeless.
If as much care were taken with script as with visuals, pic would have more impact.
